alert.note: Alert for Augusta; Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Eastern Highland; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah; Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 5:29AM EST until January 09 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulation ranging from a coating to around one inch in the Blue Ridge Mountains and valleys of the Potomac Highlands to around 1 to 3 inches near the Allegheny Front in western Maryland and eastern West Virginia. Ice accumulations ranging from less than a tenth of an inch below 2,000 feet to one to two tenths of an inch above 2,000 feet. Southeast winds gusting around 30 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of western Maryland, central, northwest and western Virginia and eastern West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute, especially near the Allegheny Front and above 2,000 feet elsewhere. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will begin as a wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain before changing to all rain by early Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Augusta; Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Eastern Highland; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah; Western Highland
